amendment.description: Amendment sought to require the EPA Administrator to take into account the potential reductions in the number of illness-related absences from work due to respiratory or other illnesses when the EPA is setting compliance deadlines.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 22 printed in the Congressional Record to take into account the potential reductions in the number of illness-related absences from work due to respiratory or other illnesses when the EPA is setting compliance deadlines.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Cohen amendment (A014) Failed by recorded vote: 174 - 250 (Roll no. 787).

action.text: Roll call votes on amendments in House
House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the Cohen amendment (A014) Failed by recorded vote: 174 - 250 (Roll no. 787).
Amendment failed in Committee of the Whole
House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A014) offered by Mr. Cohen.
